page.title: 17SUMMER FARMING IN ETTRICK.
page.content: In late April or May the hill ewes start lambing and the early lambs are cut.By the end of May all the ewes should have lambed. In June the hill cows and calves go out to the hill along with the bull. July is the time that the sheep are sheared and counted.In late July some of the crops are cut for silage.The hay isn't made till August when it is warm and dry and the grass can dry out before being baled.August is the time when the sheep are dipped and the lambs are sold.In September the tups go out to the old ewes so that they lamb first.The tups and bullocks are sold in October and any new tups are bought.
